FacilityStr1: 1/4 E. of 183, S. of blacktop road

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Farmers Cooperative Association

P.O. Box 308

Snyder, OK 73566



For futher information contact the General Manager



Risk Management Plan-Executive Summary





1.  The Facility Policy:  The owners, management, and employees of the Farmers Cooperative Asssociation, Snyder Oklahoma are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department or other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.



2.  Facility Information: The primary activity at the facility is the storage of fertilizers for sale to farmers. Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for the direct application of fertilizers for crop production nutrients.



3.  The worst case release scenario and the alternative release scenario:

   a. The worst-case release scenario would be the release of the total contents of a storage tank released as a gas over 10      minutes.

   b. The alternative release scenario is a release from a break in a transfer hose. The distance to the endpoint is 1.3 miles.





4.  The accidental release program:  The facility has implemented the provisiions of "Safey Requirements for the Storage & Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, Kk-611.1", published by The American National Standards Instute, Inc., and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia".



5.  The Five-year Accidental History:  

     a.  There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that:

          i.  Have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facililty; nor to our knowledge have resulted in any offsite deaths, injuries, evacuatioins, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



6.  The Emergency Response Program:



     The facility ha

s:



     a.  A written Emergency Action Plan, in accordance with OSHA standards, 29 CFR 1910.38;



     b.  Provided state and local authorities the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required 

          under SARA Title III (EPCRA)

     

6.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety:  Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Perodic evaluations are 

     performed to assess the maintenance of of safe conditions. There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety

     recommendations for implementation at this time.
